doc.after: Uganda is one of the poorest nations in the world, with 37.7% of the population living on less than $1.25 a day.[75] Despite making enormous progress in reducing the countrywide poverty incidence from 56% of the population in 1992 to 31% in 2005,[76] poverty remains deep-rooted in the country's rural areas, which are home to more than 85 per cent of Ugandans.
